body: You may mention clearly in the title of the two JIRAs you fixed in this single PR, next time .

you'd better rename the title to TRAFODION-2115, so the JIRA will be auto link to this PR.
Now the title without the '-' , so not auto linked.

No idea why the test fail, that should be check too.

Please use JIRA ID in the title, so the JIRA will be auto link to this PR.
FOr example [TRAFODION-2100] xxx

Once we get the error while attempting to log error row, subsequent error rows are not attempted to log at all. This fix is not taking care of transient errors with HDFS writes. These kind of errors are less likely to happen.
Please hold this yet, Windows odbc driver needs to change the version 3 conditioning to use precompile definition as well, I will push it on later.
thanks Selva, It looks good for me.
Just checking: Is this ready to merge? Any further concerns, @selvaganesang?
Are there any more review comments?
Ran a pull on a incorrect branch by accident, close this and will open a new one.
None from me. I think you can merge it.
Looks good to me. I'm not an expert in this area however.
@svarnau, any idea why this test is failing? And how to figure it out?

https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/static-checks/1228/consoleFull 
 Unapproved licenses:
   trafodion/README.md

Likely the readme file was in .rat-excludes file, but renaming README caused the exclusion to not match, hence the RAT check failed.

I'm not crazy about idea of renaming readme file just so it formats better on github.  The official use of the file is in the official code releases. The release policies talk about README files, though they don't specify a format or suffix as far as I can see.  I'm just not sure if reviewers of next release are going to complain. It probably won't hurt, but not my preference. Other opinions are welcome.
I am unable to see the difference in cstmt.cpp and cdesc.cpp. How do I view it?

Thanks @traflm for checking it out.  Currently, Trafodion needs 32 MB of locked memory per node. When you issue ipcs, you would see two segments with 32 MB  locked because there are  2 virtual nodes in developer environment . Trafodion product might lock RMS shared segment in future. RMS shared segment default is 64MB with a provision to expand upto 128MB.  So Trafodion requires  320MB of locked shared memory at most.

I believe ulimit -l is the user level limit. So, it would be good if we report an error when it is less than 64 MB and report an warning if it is less than 320MB.  Reporting warning for 40GB of locked memory per user is way too high.

In case of max user process, it would be good if we report an error if /proc/sys/kernel/pid_max is set to higher value than 65535 and possibly ignore ulimit -u settings

Can  32000 for ulimit -n be considered reasonable? This is per process limit.  I guess there will be resource/performance implications with altering these numbers.  I don't have definite answer.

I am not sure about ulimit -i pending signals.

However in summary, my suggestion is that sqstart should throw a warning or an error only when it is clear what Trafodion needs.  I would think this might need to be fixed in installer too. Otherwise, Trafodion might end up giving false indications to the customer to configure such settings.
Looks good to me. Thanks for taking care of the exceptions so that they are now being logged.
The code seems fine, however, it seems like it would be good to at least log the transid with the exceptions so we can better track down/correlate issues after the fact.
We can add a new file README.md, but keep the original README file. Is it OK for you?
The change is just the same as cstmt.cpp and cdesc.cpp for unix driver. Looks like the CR/LF all changed when pushing from Windows to github. I'll double check and re-push it.
I will add transid to the tm_log_write function.  Transid will be passed if it exists or -1  will be used.

Thanks Selva.  That will be very helpful

Makes sense. Let's wait for other opinions, if this change is not acceptable, I can close the PR.
@selvaganesang , I will change it to 64M as you suggested. and remove unclear ulimit checkings, avoid give false indication until we can make sure.
Thanks @ryzuo for changing as per review comments. Change looks good

I think I'd better abort this PR and start a new PR with all these changes. Thanks for @selvaganesang carefully review. All these are true, I think it will be good to resubmit with only one commit including all these changes.

@ryzuo, would you like to practice committing this change? The instructions on how to do it are here: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/TRAFODION/Merge+Changes#MergeChanges-MergePullRequests
This change looks good to me.
I see other places in this file where we call writeOrdering.listIterator (for example, line 546). Why don't we add the writeOrdering.size() parameter there?
Looks good RuoYu - thanks for taking care of this. Like Dave mentioned in the other PR, you could follow the steps and merge this change in if there are no further comments.

We only use the writeOrder.size() when we are adding a new put/delete to the writeOrder list to ensure that the items are added at the end of the list.  Otherwise, when iterating through the list we see the newest items first rather than the oldest items first.
